decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting, then bringing them back into play with spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate. The key strategy is to cheat out creatures like Griselbrand and Iona, Shield of Emeria as early as possible, overwhelming the opponent with their powerful effects. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Cabal Therapy and Unmask to disrupt the opponent's game plan and ensure the successful reanimation of threats.

This Death & Taxes deck focuses on disrupting opponents while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. With cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Mother of Runes slowing down opponents and protecting key threats, the deck aims to control the game through efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and disruptive creatures like Phyrexian Revoker. By utilizing Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic to cheat out powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte, the deck can quickly close out games by overwhelming opponents with a combination of resilient threats and disruption.

The focus of this deck is to quickly bring out powerful cards, such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, through the use of Show and Tell and Omniscience. The deck includes various card draw and filtering spells, like Brainstorm and Ponder, to set up the combo. Spell Pierce and Force of Will provide protection while Cunning Wish helps to search for specific cards as needed. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its quick combo potential and powerful creatures, aiming to win the game before the opponent can react effectively.

The deck focuses on quickly getting out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn by using Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience to cheat them into play. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce while using cantrips like Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm to dig for combo pieces. The deck also ramps up mana quickly with Lotus Petal and lands like Ancient Tomb, City of Traitors, and fetch lands to cast the big creatures ahead of schedule.

The main concept of this Legacy Combo - Storm deck is to utilize a variety of low-cost or free spells in order to generate a large storm count, then win the game using cards like Tendrils of Agony or Grapeshot. The deck includes cards like Ad Nauseam and Infernal Tutor to find key pieces quickly, as well as disruption in the form of Thoughtseize, Duress, and more. The mana base is streamlined for efficiency, incorporating various fetch lands and dual lands to ensure smooth gameplay and consistent combo execution.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port to disrupt opponents' mana bases, while also utilizing lands like Thespian's Stage and Dark Depths to create a powerful 20/20 Marit Lage token. Life from the Loam is used to recur key lands and Punishing Fire provides removal and recurring damage. The deck seeks to grind out victories through resource denial and powerful land interactions, ultimately overpowering opponents with a powerful land base.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana using cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, and then chain together spells like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual to build storm count. The deck aims to draw through the deck with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder, finding the key pieces needed to cast Ad Nauseam or Tendrils of Agony to win the game in a single explosive turn. The use of Infernal Tutor allows for powerful tutoring to find the necessary combo pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently use cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience to get powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield. By using cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm as protection, as well as Cunning Wish for additional flexibility, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats and win the game quickly through a powerful combo. The deck also includes cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain for card selection and manipulation to help assemble the combo pieces effectively.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token in a single turn. The deck includes cards to help search for and protect the combo pieces, disrupt the opponent's strategy with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, and control the board with removal spells like Abrupt Decay. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful, indestructible creature.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently get out powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. By utilizing cards like Omniscience, the player can cast these creatures for free and gain a significant advantage over their opponent. The deck also includes a Wish sideboard to access additional cards as needed, making it a versatile and powerful combo deck in the Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a mix of strong removal spells and hand disruption, while also generating card advantage with cards like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to control the board with efficient threats like Gurmag Angler and planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, ultimately outvaluing the opponent and grinding them out of resources. With a blend of counterspells, removal, and card draw, this deck is able to adapt to various matchups and playstyles, making it a versatile and powerful control archetype in the Legacy format.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient threats. It aims to control the board through a combination of counterspells like Force of Will and cheap disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis to chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also includes cards like Wasteland and Lightning Bolt to deal with opposing threats and disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The focus of this deck is to quickly fill our graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, and then bring them back onto the battlefield using spells like Animate Dead. This combo allows us to bypass the high casting costs of creatures like Griselbrand and Grave Titan, overwhelming our opponent with large threats early in the game. In addition, we have disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to control the board and protect our combo. With these elements, we aim to win the game before our opponent can establish their own game plan.

This deck aims to quickly establish board presence and disrupt opponents with powerful prison effects like Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void. By ramping out threats like Goblin Rabblemaster and Chandra, Torch of Defiance early on, it puts pressure on opponents and limits their options. The inclusion of cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Hazoret the Fervent ensure that the deck can still win even if the board gets stalled out. Overall, this deck prioritizes aggression and disruption to quickly close out games.

The main concept of this Legacy Stoneblade control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan using countermagic and removal spells while deploying powerful threats like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic. The deck aims to control the board through tempo plays with cards like Delver of Secrets and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, while also gaining card advantage through cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. Its efficient mana base allows for consistent access to all colors of mana, ensuring that the deck can effectively handle a variety of threats and strategies in the format.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through counterspells and removal spells, while also generating card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to control the game by utilizing cards like Counterbalance and Back to Basics to limit the opponent's options and establish board presence with creatures like Monastery Mentor. The deck also has access to powerful card draw and manipulation spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency in drawing key pieces.
